2.verse: She weepeth sore in the night,

4.verse: The ways of Zion do mourn,

6.verse: And from the daughter of Zion

9.verse: Her filthiness is in her skirts;

10.verse: The adversary hath spread out his hand

13.verse: From above hath he sent fire into my bones,

14.verse: The yoke of my transgressions is bound

15.verse: The Lord hath trodden under foot all my mighty men

20.verse: Behold, O LORD ; for I am in distress:

21.verse: They have heard that I sigh:

22.verse: Let all their wickedness come before thee;

3.verse: He hath cut off in his fierce anger

4.verse: He hath bent his bow like an enemy:

5.verse: The Lord was as an enemy:

6.verse: And he hath violently taken away his tabernacle, as if it were of a garden:

7.verse: The Lord hath cast off his altar,

8.verse: The LORD hath purposed to destroy

9.verse: Her gates are sunk into the ground;

10.verse: The elders of the daughter of Zion

11.verse: Mine eyes do fail with tears,

13.verse: What thing shall I take to witness for thee? what thing shall I liken to thee,

17.verse: The LORD hath done that which he had devised;

18.verse: Their heart cried unto the Lord,

19.verse: Arise, cry out in the night:

21.verse: The young and the old lie

1.verse: I am the man that hath seen affliction

2.verse: He hath led me, and brought me

3.verse: Surely against me is he turned; he turneth his hand

4.verse: My flesh and my skin hath he made old;

6.verse: He hath set me in dark places,

7.verse: He hath hedged me about, that I cannot get out:

8.verse: Also when I cry and shout,

9.verse: He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone,

10.verse: He was unto me as a bear lying in wait,

11.verse: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces:

12.verse: He hath bent his bow, and set me

13.verse: He hath caused the arrows of his quiver

14.verse: I was a derision to all my people;

15.verse: He hath filled me with bitterness,

16.verse: He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones,

17.verse: And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace:

18.verse: And I said, My strength and my hope

19.verse: Remembering mine affliction and my misery,

20.verse: My soul hath them still in remembrance,

21.verse: This I recall to my mind,

22.verse: It is of the LORD 's mercies that we are not consumed,

24.verse: The LORD  is my portion, saith my soul;

25.verse: The LORD  is good unto them that wait for him,

26.verse: It is good that a man should both hope and quietly

27.verse: It is good for a man that he bear

28.verse: He sitteth alone and keepeth silence,

29.verse: He putteth his mouth in the dust;

30.verse: He giveth his cheek to him that smiteth him:

32.verse: But though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion

33.verse: For he doth not afflict willingly

35.verse: To turn aside the right of a man

36.verse: To subvert a man in his cause,

37.verse: Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass,

38.verse: Out of the mouth of the Most High

39.verse: Wherefore doth a living man complain,

40.verse: Let us search and try our ways,

41.verse: Let us lift up our heart with our hands

42.verse: We have transgressed and have rebelled:

43.verse: Thou hast covered with anger, and persecuted us:

44.verse: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud,

45.verse: Thou hast made us as the offscouring and refuse

47.verse: Fear and a snare is come upon us,

48.verse: Mine eye runneth down with rivers of water

49.verse: Mine eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not,

52.verse: Mine enemies chased me sore, like a bird,

53.verse: They have cut off my life in the dungeon,

55.verse: I called upon thy name, O LORD ,

57.verse: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee:

58.verse: O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul;

59.verse: O LORD , thou hast seen my wrong:

60.verse: Thou hast seen all their vengeance

61.verse: Thou hast heard their reproach, O LORD ,

62.verse: The lips of those that rose up against me,

63.verse: Behold their sitting down, and their rising up;

64.verse: Render unto them a recompence, O LORD ,

66.verse: Persecute and destroy them in anger

1.verse: How is the gold become dim!

3.verse: Even the sea monsters draw out the breast,

4.verse: The tongue of the sucking child cleaveth

6.verse: For the punishment of the iniquity of the daughter of my people is greater

7.verse: Her Nazarites were purer than snow,

8.verse: Their visage is blacker than a coal;

9.verse: They that be slain with the sword

10.verse: The hands of the pitiful women

11.verse: The LORD hath accomplished his fury;

13.verse: For the sins of her prophets,

14.verse: They have wandered as blind men in the streets,

15.verse: They cried unto them, Depart ye; it is unclean;

16.verse: The anger of the LORD hath divided them;

17.verse: As for us, our eyes as yet failed

20.verse: The breath of our nostrils, the anointed of the LORD ,

21.verse: Rejoice and be glad, O daughter of Edom,

22.verse: The punishment of thine iniquity is accomplished, O daughter of Zion;

1.verse: Remember, O LORD , what is come upon us:

2.verse: Our inheritance is turned to strangers,

4.verse: We have drunken our water for money;

6.verse: We have given the hand to the Egyptians,

7.verse: Our fathers have sinned, and are not;

9.verse: We gat our bread with the peril of our lives

10.verse: Our skin was black like an oven

11.verse: They ravished the women in Zion,

12.verse: Princes are hanged up by their hand:

13.verse: They took the young men to grind,

14.verse: The elders have ceased from the gate,

15.verse: The joy of our heart is ceased;

16.verse: The crown is fallen from our head:

17.verse: For this our heart is faint;

18.verse: Because of the mountain of Zion, which is desolate,

19.verse: Thou, O LORD , remainest for ever;

20.verse: Wherefore dost thou forget us for ever,

21.verse: Turn thou us unto thee, O LORD , and we shall be turned;

22.verse: But thou hast utterly rejected us;
